### connecting {{< iconify logos:julia >}}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="47%"}

1. [install {{< iconify logos:julia >}}](https://bookdown.org/jtkulas/10_28_25/10_28_25.html#/section)
2. [at {{< iconify logos:julia >}} prompt line, type](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/julia/how-to-work-with-julia-on-jupyter-notebook/):
```{r}
#| eval: false
#| echo: true
using Pkg
Pkg.add("IJulia")
```
3. open {{< iconify devicon:jupyter-wordmark >}}[lab]{.juplab} & choose {{< iconify logos:julia >}} kernel

:::

> You can use [{{< iconify devicon:rstudio >}}](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) to work with [{{< iconify material-icon-theme:julia >}}](https://julialang.org/) and [{{< iconify material-icon-theme:quarto >}}](https://quarto.org/), but [{{< iconify devicon:jupyter >}}](https://docs.jupyter.org/en/latest/what_is_jupyter.html) is more seamless (Grok, 10.16.25)
